wiki.content:
this is a great redition of - blue train, with Coltrane joined by Eric Dolphy on alto and long-time bandmate, pianist McCoy tyner. MR. Coltrane had recorded -Blue Train, some years earlier on an album of the same name. It featured both Trumpeter Lee Morgan and Trombonest, Curtis Fuller, Originally released on the Blue Note label. 
        
User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: this is a great redition of - blue train, with Coltrane joined by Eric Dolphy on alto and long-time bandmate, pianist McCoy tyner. MR. Coltrane had recorded -Blue Train, some years earlier on an album of the same name. It featured both Trumpeter Lee Morgan and Trombonest, Curtis Fuller, Originally released on the Blue Note label.

name: Blue Train
comments: tonally uninhibited improvisation by Coltrane allowed subsequent generations of musicians consider him one of the pioneers of free jazz
Great. I love it, but the end of the track is rubbish - problem with the CD player!
Coltrane=genius. That is all.
No like very much
man, that sax is just amazing. that man is getting down.
Nossa, que ruim! Mentira.
One of my favorites by the man Coltrane!!!!
Blue Line (Chicago!)

got the Trane on time

The Trane is on track and steaming.
Lee is on board too. And the train is steamin.
This is it!

Tuttavia, il sangue mi richiederà dalla mano di tutti gli animali che lo richiedono, e dalla mano dell'uomo, dalla mano di suo fratello, io domanderò conto della vita dell'uomo. (1 ° Mosè 9:05 SCH2000)
So strong and beautiful.

goddamn the line at 2:18 is one his best
